definition: to rouse/to invigorate/to enliven/to put sb into high spirits/con brio
to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
to gather one's spirits/to pull oneself together

sentences.english: You might drink more later in the morning, to keep yourself energized.
sentences.chinese: 上午稍晚一點你會喝更多，爲了讓自己精神抖擻。

sentences.english: The man stepped off in good spirits.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們精神抖擻地齊步走。

sentences.english: Lemonade on a hot day is very refreshing.
sentences.chinese: 在暑天喝檸檬水，會使人精神抖擻。

sentences.english: Starting into activity, he bundled the policemen into the dining-room doorway.
sentences.chinese: 他抖擻精神，把警察推到餐室門口。

sentences.english: The horse perked up its head.
sentences.chinese: 那匹馬精神抖擻地昂起頭來。

sentences.english: During the morning walk, I’m able to mentally prepare for my workday.
sentences.chinese: 當早晨散步時，我會精神抖擻地準備好工作的一天。

sentences.english: Do things that you inspire you daily.
sentences.chinese: 做那些能讓你每天精神抖擻的事。

sentences.english: Hearing the news, the boy laughed in his sleeves.
sentences.chinese: 聽到這個消息，男孩暗自興抖擻來。

sentences.english: The king got up and was surprised to see Nasreddin in high sprits.
sentences.chinese: 國王起牀後，看到納斯雷丁精神抖擻，就吃了一驚。

sentences.english: Listen! The torn-torn is playing. How energetic I am!
sentences.chinese: 聽大鼓在演奏，我精神多抖擻。

sentences.english: No doubt this has helped the Celtic Tiger purr again.
sentences.chinese: 這無疑已幫助這隻“凱爾特之虎”再度抖擻精神。

sentences.english: The goal setting process gets employees energized and excited.
sentences.chinese: 設定目標的過程要讓員工精神抖擻，興奮不已。

sentences.english: During the joy immediately like in a man in good spirits.
sentences.chinese: 喜得李世民立即像是換了一個人一樣精神抖擻。
我的精神抖擻可讓你煩惱？

definition: lit. both sleeves flowing in the breeze (idiom); having clean hands/uncorrupted/unsoiled by corrupt practices
(literary) to practice medicine/to work as a pharmacist
tough upright grass/fig. a staunch character able to withstand tough test
Silkworms in Spring (1933), Chinese silent movie in socialist realist style, based on novel by Mao Dun 茅盾[Mao2 Dun4]
